title: Creating survival plot
code: # Load required libraries library(survSAKK) library(survival)  # Load data veteran <- survival::veteran  # Define the reference arm veteran$trt <- factor(veteran$trt,                       levels = c(1,2),                       labels = c("Standard","Test"))  # Create survival objects veteran_fit_yr <- survfit(Surv(time / 365.25, status) ~ 1, data = veteran) veteran_fit_mt <- survfit(Surv(time / 365.25 * 12, status) ~ 1, data = veteran) veteran_trt_fit_yr <- survfit(Surv(time / 365.25, status) ~ trt, data = veteran) veteran_trt_fit_mt <- survfit(Surv(time / 365.25 * 12, status) ~ trt, data = veteran)

title: Creating survival plot
code: surv.plot(veteran_fit_yr)

previous_headings: Drawing survival plot > Customisation of axis limits and label
what: Renaming of the labels and Axis:
title: Creating survival plot
code: surv.plot(veteran_fit_yr,           # Label           main = "Veterans' Administration Lung Cancer study",            xlab = "Time (year)",            legend.name = c("Veteran's"),           # Limits           xlim = seq(0,3,by = 0.5))

previous_headings: Drawing survival plot > Customisation of axis limits and label
title: Creating survival plot
code: surv.plot(veteran_fit_yr,           # Label           main = "Veterans' Administration Lung Cancer study",            xlab = "Time (year)",            legend.name = c("Veteran's"),           # Limits           xlim = seq(0,3,by = 0.5),           cex = 0.8)

previous_headings: Drawing survival plot > Customisation of axis limits and label
what: Custamisation of the x and y axis label position
title: Creating survival plot
code: surv.plot(veteran_trt_fit_yr,           # Specifies on which line on the plotting area            # X and Y label should be drawn           xlab.pos = 3,           ylab.pos = 3.75)

title: Creating survival plot
code: surv.plot(veteran_fit_yr,             # How many bottom lines should be drawn           margin.bottom = 10,           # How many left lines should be drawn           margin.left = 8)

title: Creating survival plot
text: section shown highlight specific quantile time point segment survival curve adjust segment options.

what: Drawing segment line for a specific quantile
title: Creating survival plot
text: Drawing segment line median, corresponds 0.5 quantile.
code: surv.plot(veteran_fit_yr,           # Segment Options           segment.quantile = 0.5)

what: Drawing segment line for a specific time point
title: Creating survival plot
text: Drawing segment line time point 1.
code: surv.plot(veteran_fit_yr,           # Segment Options           segment.timepoint = 1)

what: Renaming segment title, font size, and colour
title: Creating survival plot
code: surv.plot(veteran_fit_yr,           # Segment Options           segment.quantile = 0.5,           segment.main = "Median survival time",           segment.annotation = "bottomleft",           segment.cex = 0.75,           segment.col = "darkred")

what: Add several segment lines, change line type
title: Creating survival plot
code: surv.plot(veteran_fit_yr,           # Segment Options           segment.timepoint = c(0.5,1,2),           segment.type = 2,           segment.annotation = "none")

title: Creating survival plot
code: surv.plot(veteran_fit_yr,           # Segment Options           segment.quantile = 0.5,           segment.type = 1,           segment.cex = 0.75,           segment.font = 3,           segment.main.font = 2)

what: Modify segment line type, line width and text spacing
title: Creating survival plot
code: surv.plot(veteran_fit_yr,           # Segment Options           segment.quantile = 0.5,           segment.annotation = c(3, 0.06),           segment.col = "darkgreen",           ## segment type            segment.type = 1,           ## segment line type           segment.lty = 'dotted',           ## segment line width           segment.lwd = 1.5,           # spacing between the text in unit of x-coordinates           segment.annotation.space = 0.16)

title: Creating survival plot
text: three options display statistics: logrank gives p value conducted log rank test using survdiff{survival}. coxph gives hazard ratio (HR) 95% CI conducted Cox proportional hazards regression using coxph{survival}.‚Å† coxmodel gives N (number observations), Events (Number events), HR(hazard ratio), lwrCI (lower 95% confidence interval), uprCI (upper 95% confidence interval) Logrank (p-value corresponding Chisquare statistic) conduct Cox proportional hazards regression using summary(coxph{survival}).

title: Creating survival plot
code: surv.plot(veteran_trt_fit_yr,           stat = "logrank")

title: Creating survival plot
code: surv.plot(veteran_trt_fit_yr,           show.legend = FALSE,           stat = "coxph",           stat.position = "bottomright")

title: Creating survival plot
code: surv.plot(veteran_trt_fit_yr,           legend.position = "right",           stat = "coxmodel",           stat.position = "topright")

what: Modify stat position, colour, text size, and text font
title: Creating survival plot
code: surv.plot(veteran_trt_fit_yr,           # Segment Options           stat = "logrank",           stat.position = "bottomright",           stat.col = "darkblue",           stat.cex = 0.85,           stat.font = 2)

title: Creating survival plot
text: Per default risk table provided Kaplan-Meier plot. provides information number patients risk different time points thought study.

title: Creating survival plot
code: surv.plot(veteran_trt_fit_yr,           risktable = FALSE)

title: Creating survival plot
code: surv.plot(veteran_fit_yr,             # How many bottom lines should be drawn           margin.bottom = 10,           # How many left lines should be drawn           margin.left = 4,           # Define position of the risk table           risktable.pos = 8.5)

title: Creating survival plot
text: ## Modify risk table label names
code: surv.plot(veteran_fit_yr,           risktable.title = "# at risk",           risktable.title.font = 3,           risktable.title.col = "purple",           # specifying the position of the title on the x-axis           risktable.title.position = -0.5) surv.plot(veteran_fit_yr,           risktable.name.col = "darkgreen",           risktable.name.font = 3,           # specifying the position of the title on the x-axis           risktable.name.position = -0.45)

title: Creating survival plot
code: surv.plot(veteran_fit_yr,           risktable.col = "darkred")

title: Creating survival plot
code: surv.plot(veteran_fit_yr,           risktable.cex = 0.9,           risktable.title.cex = 0.85,           risktable.name.cex = 0.80)

title: Creating survival plot
code: par(mfrow=c(2,2)) # Plot 1 surv.plot(fit = veteran_fit_yr,           cex = 0.8,           risktable.name.position = -0.7) # Plot 2 surv.plot(fit = veteran_fit_yr,            xlim = seq(0,3,0.5),           cex = 0.8,           segment.quantile = 0.5,           segment.annotation = "none",           risktable.name.position = -0.5) # Plot 3 surv.plot(fit = veteran_fit_yr,            col = "darkred",           xlim = seq(0,3,0.5),           cex = 0.8,           legend.name = "Veterans",           show.legend = FALSE,           segment.quantile = 0.5,           segment.annotation = "right",           segment.cex = 0.7,           risktable.name.position = -0.7) par(mfrow=c(1,1)) par(mfrow=c(2,1)) # Plot 1 surv.plot(fit = veteran_trt_fit_yr,           bty = 'o',           legend.title = "Treament regimens",           legend.name = c("LT60","OV60"),           legend.text.font = 2,           col = c("darkred", "darkblue"),           xlim = seq(0,3, by = 0.5),           xlab = ("Time (month)"),           segment.quantile = 0.5,           stat = "logrank",            stat.position = "bottomleft",           risktable.col = c("darkred","darkblue"))  # Plot 2 surv.plot(fit = veteran_trt_fit_yr,           grid =TRUE,           col = c("darkgreen","yellow4"),           xlab = "Time (year)",           xlim = seq(0,3, by = 1),           legend.position = "bottomleft",           stat = "coxmodel",           stat.position = "bottomright") par(mfrow=c(1,1))

title: Create publication ready Kaplan-Meier plot
text: goal survSAKK create open source, user-friendly flexible R package, incorporate various statistics layout customization options enhance efficiency adaptability Kaplan-Meier plot.

title: Create publication ready Kaplan-Meier plot
text: can install current version survSAKK GitHub Pages:
code: # install.packages("devtools")  # At the moment, while repository is private: devtools::install_github("SAKK-Statistics/survSAKK",                          auth_token = "ask_for_the_password",                          build_vignettes = TRUE,                          force = TRUE)  # Later, when the repository is public: devtools::install_github("SAKK-Statistics/survSAKK",                          build_vignettes = TRUE)

title: Create publication ready Kaplan-Meier plot
code: library(survSAKK) library(survival) #> Warning: Paket 'survival' wurde unter R Version 4.3.2 erstellt  lung_fit <- survfit(Surv((time/365.25), status) ~ sex, data = lung)  surv.plot(fit = lung_fit)

what: A package for publication ready Kaplan-Meier plots. ‚Äî surv.plot
title: A package for publication ready Kaplan-Meier plots. ‚Äî surv.plot
text: Plot Kaplan-Meier plot using results survival::survfit().

title: A package for publication ready Kaplan-Meier plots. ‚Äî surv.plot
code: surv.plot(   fit,   margin.bottom = NULL,   margin.left = NULL,   mark.censoring = TRUE,   conf.int = fit$conf.int,   conf.band = TRUE,   conf.line = FALSE,   conf.band.col = col,   conf.band.transparent = 0.25,   conf.type = "log-log",   grid = FALSE,   col = NULL,   main = NULL,   sub = NULL,   xlab = "Time",   ylab = "Estimated survival probability",   xlab.pos = 1.5,   ylab.pos = 2.5,   cex = NULL,   cex.lab = 1,   cex.axis = 1,   bty = "l",   lty = c("solid", "dotted", "dotted"),   lwd = 1,   xlim = seq(from = 0, to = ceiling(max(fit$time)) + ceiling(min(fit$time))),   ylim = seq(from = 0, to = 1, by = 0.25),   show.legend = TRUE,   legend.position = "topright",   legend.name = NULL,   legend.text.font = 1,   legend.cex = 1,   legend.title = NULL,   legend.title.cex = 1,   segment.type = 3,   segment.timepoint = NULL,   segment.quantile = NULL,   segment.main = NULL,   segment.annotation = "right",   segment.col = "#666666",   segment.annotation.col = col,   segment.lty = "dashed",   segment.lwd = 1,   segment.cex = 1,   segment.annotation.space = 0.06,   segment.font = 1,   segment.main.font = 1,   stat = "none",   stat.position = "bottomleft",   stat.col = "black",   stat.cex = 1,   stat.font = 1,   risktable = TRUE,   risktable.pos = 3,   risktable.title = "Number at risk",   risktable.title.font = 2,   risktable.title.col = "black",   risktable.title.position = par("usr")[1] - (par("usr")[2] - par("usr")[1]) * 0.15,   risktable.cex = 1,   risktable.title.cex = 1,   risktable.name.cex = 1,   risktable.col = "black",   risktable.name.font = 1,   risktable.name.col = "#666666",   risktable.name.position = par("usr")[1] - (par("usr")[2] - par("usr")[1]) * 0.15 )

title: A package for publication ready Kaplan-Meier plots. ‚Äî surv.plot
text: fit object class survfit containing survival data. margin.bottom Specifies bottom margin plotting area line units. margin.left Specifies left margin plotting area risktable line units. mark.censoring logical parameter indicating whether mark censoring events survival curves. Default: TRUE. conf.int Controlling confidence interval survival curves. set TRUE, function displays default 95% confidence interval. set FALSE, confidence intervals displayed. numeric value 0 1 provided, represents desired coverage confidence interval (e.g. 0.9 90%). conf.band logical parameter indicating whether display confidence band survival curves. Default: TRUE. conf.line logical parameter indicating whether draw confidence line survival curves. Default: FALSE. conf.band.col Colour(s) confidence band. Can accept single value colour, vector colour values. conf.band.transparent numeric values 0 1. Controlling transparency confidence band. Default: 0.25. conf.type Transformation type confidence interval. 'log', 'log-log' (default), 'plain', 'logit', 'arcsin'. grid logical parameter specifying whether draw grid. Default: FALSE. col Colour(s) survival curves. Can accept single value colour, vector colour values set colour(s). main Title plot. sub Subtitle plot. xlab X-axis label. ylab Y-axis label. xlab.pos Defines MARgin line xlab displayed. Starting 0 counting outwards. ylab.pos Defines MARgin line ylab displayed. Starting 0 counting outwards. cex numeric value specifying size text elements (labels, annotations, ...). cex.lab numeric value specifying size xlab ylab text. cex.axis numeric value specifying size axis size. bty Determines style box drawn around plot. Options: 'n','o','7','L','C','U'. lty vector string specifying line types curve. length vector match number survival curves, assigning specific line type curve. plot. Options: 'blank', 'solid', 'dashed', 'dotted', 'dotdash', 'longdash', 'twodash'. lwd numeric value specifying width line. xlim Limits x-axis. Specified seq(starting value, end value, number increment sequence). ylim Limits y-axis. Specified seq(starting value, end value, number increment sequence). show.legend logical parameter specifying whether display legend. Default: TRUE. legend.position Position legend. Options: c(x,y), 'bottomright', 'bottom', 'bottomleft', 'left', 'topleft', 'top', 'topright', 'right', 'center'. legend.name Renaming name(s) stratum. legend.text.font Font style legend text. 1 normal 2 bold 3 italic 4 bold italic legend.cex numeric value specifying size legend text. legend.title Title legend. legend.title.cex numeric value specifying size legend title. segment.type numeric value specifying layout segment. 1 (full width) 2 (half width) 3 (vertical horizontal segment) segment.timepoint single value vector fixed time points drawn segment(s). segment.quantile single value vector fixed quantile drawn segment(s) e.g. 0.5 corresponds median. segment.main Title segment text. segment.annotation Position segment annotation. Options: c(x,y),'bottomleft', 'left', 'right', 'none'. segment.col Colour segment.  Can accept single value colour. segment.annotation.col Colour(s) segment annotation. Can accept single value colour, vector colour values set colour(s). segment.lty vector string specifying line types curve. Options: 'blank', 'solid', 'dashed', 'dotted', 'dotdash', 'longdash', 'twodash'. segment.lwd numeric value specifying width segment line. segment.cex numeric value specifying size segment text size. segment.annotation.space Spacing text unit x-coordinates. segment.font numeric value specifying font face. 1 plain 2 bold 3 italic 4 bold-italic segment.main.font numeric value specifying font face. 1 plain 2 bold 3 italic 4 bold-italic stat Statistics displayed plot. Options: 'logrank' gives p value conducted logrank test using survdiff{survival}. tests difference two survival curves. 'coxph'  gives hazard ratio (HR) 95% CI conducted Cox proportional hazards regression using coxph{survival}. 'coxmodel' gives N (number observations), Events (Number events), HR(hazard ratio), lwrCI (lower 95% confidence interval), uprCI (upper 95% confidence interval) Logrank (p-value corresponding Chisquare statistic) conduct Cox proportional hazards regression using summary(coxph{survival}). 'none' statistic displayed (default). stat.position Position stat displayed. Options: specify explicit c(x,y),'bottomleft', 'left', 'right', 'topright','bottomright', 'none'. stat.col Colour stat text. Can accept single value colour. stat.cex numeric value specifying size stat text size. stat.font font face. 1 plain 2 bold 3 italic 4 bold-italic risktable logical parameter indicating whether draw risk table. Default: TRUE. risktable.pos Defines MARgin line xlab displayed. Starting 0 counting outwards. Default line 4. drawn risktable drawn. Default: 2.5 line distances form axis elements. risktable.title Title risk table. risktable.title.font Title font risk table. 1 normal 2 bold 3 italic 4 bold italic risktable.title.col Colour risk table title. Can accept single value colour. risktable.title.position numeric value specifying position title x-axis. risktable.cex numeric value specifying size risk table text size. risktable.title.cex numeric value specifying size risk table title size. risktable.name.cex numeric value specifying size rsik table legend name size. risktable.col Colour(s) risk table. Can accept single value colour, vector colour values set colour(s). risktable.name.font legend name(s) font risk table. 1 normal 2 bold 3 italic 4 bold italic risktable.name.col Colour risk table name. Can accept single value colour. risktable.name.position numeric value specifying position legend name(s) x-axis.

title: A package for publication ready Kaplan-Meier plots. ‚Äî surv.plot
text: Publication-Ready Kaplan-Meier Plot incorporating various statistics layout customisation options enhance efficiency adaptability Kaplan-Meier plot.

title: A package for publication ready Kaplan-Meier plots. ‚Äî surv.plot
text: vignette("surv.plot", package = "survSAKK")

title: A package for publication ready Kaplan-Meier plots. ‚Äî surv.plot
code: # Load Libraray  require(survival)  require(survSAKK)  # Load Data  veteran$time_yr <- veteran$time/365.25  veteran$time_mt <- veteran$time_yr*12  # Create survival object  veteran_fit_yr <- survfit(Surv(time / 365.25, status) ~ 1, data = veteran)  veteran_trt_fit_mt <- survfit(Surv(time / 365.12 * 12, status) ~ trt, data = veteran)  # Generate survival plots  survSAKK::surv.plot(fit = veteran_fit_yr)    survSAKK::surv.plot(  fit = veteran_trt_fit_mt,  col = c("#5ab4ac","#d8b365"),  cex = 0.8,  segment.quantile = 0.5,  stat = "coxph",  risktable.col = c("#5ab4ac","#d8b365"))
